column2: result <- depression %>% group_by(Gender, Depression) %>% summarise(Count = n()) %>% mutate(Percentage = round((Count / sum(Count)) * 100, 2))
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Gender'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
ggplot(result, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = interaction(Gender, Depression))) +
title = "Pie Chart of Count by Gender and Depression",
